Operation 'getEverything' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic and doesn't convey the filtering/search capabilities. Description lacks information about input parameters (filtering options), output structure (paginated results with article fields), and use cases. Enhanced version clarifies what can be searched, what filters are available, what data is returned, and when an AI agent should use this operation versus getTopHeadlines.

data.current_description: Search through millions of articles from over 150,000 large and small news sources and blogs
data.summary_suggestion: Search and filter news articles across all sources
data.description_suggestion: Searches through millions of articles from over 150,000 news sources and blogs worldwide. Supports filtering by keywords, date range, language, sort order, and other criteria. Returns paginated results containing article metadata including title, description, URL, source, publication date, and author. Useful for comprehensive news research and monitoring across all available sources.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't convey the filtering/search capabilities. Description lacks information about input parameters (filtering options), output structure (paginated results with article fields), and use cases. Enhanced version clarifies what can be searched, what filters are available, what data is returned, and when an AI agent should use this operation versus getTopHeadlines.

message: Operation 'getTopHeadlines' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to clarify input options (country/category/source filtering), output structure (paginated headline articles with specific fields), pagination support, and the distinction from getEverything endpoint to help AI agents choose the correct operation.

data.current_description: Returns live top and breaking headlines for a country, category, or source
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves live top and breaking headlines filtered by country, category, or specific news source. Supports pagination and sorting. Returns current headline articles with metadata including title, description, URL, source, publication date, and author image. Limited to the most recent and trending articles. Use this endpoint for real-time headline monitoring rather than comprehensive news searches.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to clarify input options (country/category/source filtering), output structure (paginated headline articles with specific fields), pagination support, and the distinction from getEverything endpoint to help AI agents choose the correct operation.

message: Operation 'getSources' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable. Original summary is too vague ('Get news sources' could mean many things). Description is unclear about purpose and lacks actionable details. Enhanced version clarifies that this lists sources specifically for top headlines, explains filtering capabilities, specifies what source metadata is returned, and provides clear use cases for when an AI agent should call this endpoint (discovery, filtering, or maintaining source registry).

data.current_description: Returns the subset of news publishers that top headlines are available from. It's mainly a convenience endpoint that you can use to keep track of the publishers available on the API.
data.summary_suggestion: List available news sources for top headlines
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the complete list of news publishers and sources available for the top headlines endpoint. Supports filtering by country and category. Returns source metadata including name, ID, description, URL, category, language, and country. Use this endpoint to discover available news sources before querying top headlines or to maintain an updated registry of publishers supported by the API.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague ('Get news sources' could mean many things). Description is unclear about purpose and lacks actionable details. Enhanced version clarifies that this lists sources specifically for top headlines, explains filtering capabilities, specifies what source metadata is returned, and provides clear use cases for when an AI agent should call this endpoint (discovery, filtering, or maintaining source registry).
